name: NETXP LINUX Suspicious Shell Commands executed
description: Monitors executions of suspicious shell commands that may be indicative of malicious activities. This rule covers a variety of shell commands, including ash, csh, fish, tcsh, tclsh, xonsh, and others. Detection of these commands helps in identifying potential malicious activity or unauthorized access attempts.
author: Szymon Gluch
query:
//any where auditd.log.key: "susp_shell" and 
any where event.module: "auditd"
